thread.title: Reports: Florida QB Will Grier (illness) uncertain to play vs. Ole Miss
thread.title_full: Reports: Florida QB Will Grier (illness) uncertain to play vs. Ole Miss - CBSSports.com

author: Robby Kalland
title: Reports: Florida QB Will Grier (illness) uncertain to play vs. Ole Miss
text:
On Monday, Florida coach Jim McElwain noted that nine of his players showed up for flu shot day already with the flu .
McElwain did not give out specific names, but according to multiple reports, quarterback Will Grier is one of the Gators that has been suffering from an illness this week and his status is now uncertain for Saturday against No. 3 Ole Miss.

Confirmed via source: Gators QB Will Grier battling illness and might not start vs 3rd-ranked Ole Miss
— Mark Long (@APMarkLong) October 2, 2015 McElwain named Grier the starter for the Ole Miss game earlier this week, but now his status seems uncertain for Saturday. However, according to Grier's dad, the flu won't keep him off the field. 

Talked to Will Grier's dad. He said no way the flu is keeping his son off the field.
— Pat Dooley (@pat_dooley) October 2, 2015 The flu, specifically, might not, but the coaching staff could hold him out if he's not well enough. If that were the case, Treon Harris -- back this week from a one-week suspension -- would be back in the starting role after Grier took that from him in Week 2. 
This entire situation is less than ideal for Florida, which will either have to start Grier coming off of an illness or Harris, who was just suspended for a week, against an Ole Miss defense that is one of the toughest in the country. Will Grier's status is reportedly uncertain due to illness. (USATSI) Topics: Treon Harris , Will Grier , SEC , Florida Gators , Ole Miss Rebels , NCAAF
